intro: Amyema basilanensis, commonly known as the Mindanao starling or Mindanao starling tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to the Philippines, particularly found in the islands of Mindanao and Basilan. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, glossy leaves. It thrives in tropical rainforests and is often found in secondary growth areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
